description.narrative: The Bakhresa Group, established in 1983, operates milling businesses in Kenya, Tanzania and Uganda, Zanzibar and Malawi. The Group has invested in new mills and grain storage to cater for the growing demand and market opportunity for its flour in the region. The Group objective it to continue to reduce its production costs and offer affordable flour for consumption in the Eastern Africa region. In this context, the Group has indicated further interest with new expansion projects in Mozambique. Also, it would consider the purchase of additional transport equipment for its existing mill in Rwanda; and additional financing options for Tanzania (Said Salim Bakhresa & Company Ltd.) at a later stage.

The proposed projects will have the following impacts: (i) local production of flour, substituting for flour imports with consequent impact on value added, service to local bakeries, employment, SME reach and contributions to government revenues through increased income taxes; (ii) Improved logistics, via rail and road.

name.narrative: The projects have three (3) separate locations as described below: Nacala (Mozambique) mill would be located in Nacala industrial zone, where Bakhresa has already purchased a land, some 9 km away from the port and on the main road in/out of Nacala. Kigali (Rwanda) transport project would be located nearby the existing BGM Rwanda mill, currently under construction. The mill is located in the new Kigali Industrial Park (KIP), which is managed by Rwanda Investment Group (RIG). Bakhresa has recently finalized the land acquisition process.
